14.87.text: Server: May I help you, sir?

22.03.text: Server: We have pan seared registry error

23.90.text: sprinkled with the finest corrupted data,

29.64.text:
and a scripting salad with or
without polymorphic dressing,

38.63.text: Customer: I'd like a RAM sandwich

41.38.text: and a glass of your finest Code 39.

44.89.text: Server: Would you like any desserts, sir?

49.21.text:
Customer: I'd like a batch of some
zombie tracking cookies, thank you.

54.13.text: Your food will be served shortly.

64.74.text:
Maya Penn: I've been drawing ever
since I could hold a crayon,

68.03.text: and I've been making animated flip books

70.12.text: since I was three years old.

72.06.text:
At that age, I also learned
about what an animator was.

75.25.text: There was a program on TV about jobs

79.35.text: When I understood that an animator

81.10.text: makes the cartoons I saw on TV,

82.93.text: I immediately said, "That's what I want to be."

86.71.text: I don't know if I said it mentally or out loud,

89.02.text: but that was a greatly defining moment in my life.

92.90.text: Animation and art has always been my first love.

97.23.text: It was my love for technology that sparked the idea

101.22.text: There was a virus on my computer,

102.96.text: and I was trying to get rid of it,

104.60.text: and all of a sudden, I just thought,

106.48.text:
what if viruses have their own
little world inside the computer?

109.42.text: Maybe a restaurant where they meet up

116.50.text: At four years old, my dad showed me

118.65.text:
how to take apart a computer
and put it back together again.

121.51.text: That started my love for technology.

124.12.text: I built my first website myself in HTML,

127.15.text: and I'm learning JavaScript and Python.

129.67.text: I'm also working on an animated series

132.67.text:
It's about bees and other
pollinators in our environment

137.25.text: If plants aren't pollinated by the pollinators,

141.77.text: that depend on these plants, would starve.

144.29.text: So I decided to take these cool creatures

170.15.text: Pollinator: Deforestsaurus! I should have known!

172.63.text: I need to call on the rest of the Pollinators!

189.52.text: All of my animations start with ideas,

203.01.text: Ideas truly are what make the world go round.

206.63.text: If it wasn't for ideas, we wouldn't be

209.06.text: where we are now with technology, medicine,

211.04.text: art, culture, and how we even live our lives.

215.13.text: At eight years old, I took my ideas

217.39.text: and started my own business called Maya's Ideas,

220.33.text: and my nonprofit, Maya's Ideas for the Planet.

224.85.text: And I make eco-friendly clothing and accessories.

228.30.text: I'm 13 now, and although I started my business

232.39.text: my artistic journey started way before then.

235.70.text: I was greatly influenced by art, and I wanted to

237.99.text: incorporate it in everything I did, even my business.

241.01.text: I would find different fabrics around the house,

243.01.text: and say, &quot;This could be a scarf or a hat,&quot;

245.26.text: and I had all these ideas for designs.

248.37.text: I noticed when I wore my creations,

250.23.text: people would stop me and say,

251.68.text: "Wow, that's really cute. Where can I get one?"

253.73.text: And I thought, I can start my own business.

256.92.text: Now I didn't have any business plans

260.56.text: I only knew I wanted to make pretty creations

262.58.text: that were safe for the environment

263.84.text: and I wanted to give back.

265.88.text: My mom taught me how to sew,

267.70.text: and on my back porch, I would sit and make

271.22.text:
and I would write down the names
and the price of each item.

273.82.text: I started making more items like hats,

278.09.text: Soon, my items began selling all over the world,

280.49.text: and I had customers in Denmark, Italy, Australia,

285.93.text: Now, I had a lot to learn about my business,

291.94.text: and seeing what sold the most and the least.

295.42.text: Soon, my business really started to take off.

297.84.text:
Then one day, Forbes magazine 
contacted me when I was 10 years old.

303.68.text: They wanted to feature me and my company

308.04.text: Now a lot of people ask me,

312.54.text: I've had a passion for protecting the environment

315.07.text: and its creatures since I was little.

317.11.text: My parents taught me at an early age

319.03.text:
about giving back and being a
good steward to the environment.

322.32.text: I heard about how the dyes in some clothing

324.39.text: or the process of even making the items

326.53.text: was harmful to the people and the planet,

329.11.text: so I started doing my own research,

331.26.text:
and I discovered that even
after dyeing has being completed,

334.36.text: there is a waste issue that gives a negative impact

338.00.text: For example, the grinding of materials,

339.99.text: or the dumping of dried powder materials.

342.72.text: These actions can pollute the air,

344.42.text: making it toxic to anyone or anything that inhales it.

348.18.text: So when I started my business,

352.00.text: All of my items had to be eco-friendly,

354.71.text: and 10 to 20 percent of the profits I made

356.98.text: went to local and global charities

364.59.text: I feel I'm part of the new wave of entrepreneurs

367.14.text: that not only seeks to have a successful business,

372.17.text: I feel that I can meet the needs of my customers

374.16.text:
without compromising the
ability of future generations

376.99.text: to live in a greener tomorrow.

379.58.text: We live in a big, diverse and beautiful world,

382.18.text: and that makes me even more passionate to save it.

384.64.text:
But it's never enough to just
to get it through your heads

387.01.text: about the things that are happening in our world.

389.20.text: It takes to get it through your hearts,

391.50.text: because when you get it through your heart,

393.10.text: that is when movements are sparked.

398.25.text: and that is why ideas come to life.

401.28.text: Thank you, and peace and blessings.

414.72.text: Pat Mitchell: So, you heard Maya talk about

418.02.text: the amazing parents who are behind

420.84.text: this incredible woman. Where are they?

423.06.text: Please, Mr. and Mrs. Penn. Would you just -- Ah!
